summary: This is an automated email digest from the U.S. Department of Justice spam control system, notifying a user of one quarantined email. The quarantined email has a subject line referencing 'Epstein's Buddy' and 'Clinton', suggesting it is spam or unsolicited commentary related to the Epstein case.
keyFacts: The document is an automated spam quarantine notification from the U.S. Department of Justice dated August 25, 2020.
It shows one quarantined email with a subject line 'Epstein's Buddy anti Clinton' from August 24, 2020.
The email was blocked with a high spam score of 100, indicating it was likely unsolicited commentary or conspiracy-related spam.
The document itself contains no substantive case information, only metadata about a blocked email.
It demonstrates that Epstein-related spam emails were being sent to and filtered by DOJ email systems in 2020.
